is null.
or is negative.

The buffer containing data to write to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to write.
member.exception: length minus is less than .
is null.
or is negative.
The stream does not support writing.
The stream is closed.

member.param: When the operation completes, contains the specified character array with the values between index and (index + count - 1) replaced by the characters read from the current source.
The maximum number of characters to read. If the end of the stream is reached before count of characters is read into buffer, the current method returns.
The place in buffer at which to begin writing.
the source reader.
member.returns: A Task that represents the asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: This method is not currently implemented using asynchronous I/O.

member.name: T:System.Progress`1
member.summary: Provides an IProgress{T} that invokes callbacks for each reported progress value.
member.typeparam: Specifies the type of the progress report value.
member.remarks: Any handler provided to the constructor or event handlers registered with the event are invoked through a instance captured when the instance is constructed. If there is no current SynchronizationContext at the time of construction, the callbacks will be invoked on the ThreadPool.

member.summary: Defines a provider for progress updates.

member.summary: The synchronization context captured upon construction. This will never be null.

member.summary: The handler specified to the constructor. This may be null.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskEx.Delay(System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts a Task that will complete after the specified due time.

member.returns: The timed Task.
member.exception: The argument must be non-negative or -1 and less than or equal to Int32.MaxValue.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskEx.WhenAll(System.Threading.Tasks.Task[])
member.summary: Creates a Task that will complete only when all of the provided collection of Tasks has completed.
member.param: The Tasks to monitor for completion.
member.returns: A Task that represents the completion of all of the provided tasks.
member.remarks: If any of the provided Tasks faults, the returned Task will also fault, and its Exception will contain information about all of the faulted tasks. If no Tasks fault but one or more Tasks is canceled, the returned Task will also be canceled.
member.exception: The argument is null.
The argument contains a null reference.

member.summary: Creates a Task that will complete only when all of the provided collection of Tasks has completed.

The argument contains a null reference.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskEx.WhenAny(System.Threading.Tasks.Task[])
member.summary: Creates a Task that will complete when any of the tasks in the provided collection completes.
member.param: The Tasks to be monitored.
member.returns: A Task that represents the completion of any of the provided Tasks. The completed Task is this Task's result.
member.remarks: Any Tasks that fault will need to have their exceptions observed elsewhere.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskEx.Yield
member.summary: Creates an awaitable that asynchronously yields back to the current context when awaited.
member.returns: A context that, when awaited, will asynchronously transition back into the current context. If SynchronizationContext.Current is non-null, that is treated as the current context. Otherwise, TaskScheduler.Current is treated as the current context.

member.param: The result from which to create the completed task.
member.returns: The completed task.
